casebody.data:
STATE EX REL. UTILITIES COMMISSION
v.
ATTORNEY GENERAL 271A18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. October 24, 2018 Margaret A. Force, Assistant Attorney General, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Jennifer T. Harrod, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Teresa L. Townsend, Assistant Attorney General, James W. Doggett, Deputy Solicitor General, for Stein, Josh (Attorney General). Kiran H. Mehta, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Molly Leigh McIntosh, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Duke Energy Progress, LLC. Matthew D. Quinn, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Sierra Club. David T. Drooz, Staff Attorney, Lucy E. Edmondson, Staff Attorney, Raleigh, for Public Staff-N.C. Utilities Commission. James P. West, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Fayetteville Public Works Commission. Kyle J. Smith, Attorney at Law, for Department of Defense/Federal Executive Agencies

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 3rd of October 2018 by Intervenor Bridget M. Lee for Admission Pro Hac Vice:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 24th of October 2018."
